attributes.action: stop treating this country's current and ex armed forces personnel as second class citizens, and extend the current anti-discrimination laws to protect our servicemen and women alongside the rest of the population.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This country openly discriminates against the members of it's own armed forces.
Our brave boys and girls are not even allowed to wear their uniforms on the very streets they signed up to defend without being subjected to abuse and hatred.

This would not happen in the USA, or even closer to home in the Republic of Ireland, so why is it allowed to happen here?

If an individual was treated in this way on the grounds of race, religion or sexuality, it would be regarded as a hate crime and would result in the prosecution of the abuser.

Why are our armed forces personnel exempt from this protection?

I respectfully petition the Prime Minister to make it an offence to abuse or asault members of our armed forces, punishable under the same anti-discrimination legislation that protects all other minorities.

To do otherwise is to insult every man and woman who has laid down their lives in defence of this nation.
